alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 11:52PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Douglas, western Arapahoe and southwestern Denver Counties through 1230 AM MDT... At 1151 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over northwestern Highlands Ranch, or 11 miles south of Denver, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. Heavy rain will also create street flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Denver, Aurora, Centennial, Highlands Ranch, Parker, Littleton, Englewood, Greenwood Village, Lone Tree, Sheridan, Arapahoe Park, Buckley SFB and northern Castle Pines. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County
